Description: Lower body fragment of East Greek large pottery open vessel. Two friezes preserved, divided by band with added red band: above, browsing goat to right; part of one foreleg and the head preserved; in the field, an outline rosette and a wheel rosette; below, filling ornament? Added red for the goat's pupil and on its neck, and for the ornament(?) in the lower frieze. Interior glazed black with added red band. Repair hole in upper left part of fragment, another at its lower right edge.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 18, no. 56 pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.888)
